intro: Alcea kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Iran. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and red. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Alcea kurdica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
